components.description:
The number eighteen with a red stroke through it, indicating a location where a person must be aged 18 or above to enter. Often used online to indicate adult or NSFW content.

Google's design includes the text "under" above the number eighteen.

The Samsung version of this emoji previously displayed the number 19. This may have been due to the practice of counting the first year of life as one instead of zero in parts of East Asia such as South Korea (the location of the Samsung Headquarters).
components.title: No One Under Eighteen Symbol

description:
The number eighteen with a red stroke through it, indicating a location where a person must be aged 18 or above to enter. Often used online to indicate adult or NSFW content.

Google's design includes the text "under" above the number eighteen.

The Samsung version of this emoji previously displayed the number 19. This may have been due to the practice of counting the first year of life as one instead of zero in parts of East Asia such as South Korea (the location of the Samsung Headquarters).
title: No One Under Eighteen Symbol

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Enclosed alphanumeric symbols

bn:00104562a: Contrary to or forbidden by law, especially criminal law.

Contrary to or forbidden by law.

In the early part of growth or life; born not long ago.
(used of living things especially persons) in an early period of life or development or growth

To forbid, disallow, or proscribe; to make illegal or illicit.

A perceptible indication of something not immediately apparent, as a visible clue that something has happened.

bn:00058285n: A concept of quantity involving zero and units
Mathematical object used to count, label, and measure
A number is one of several related types of mathematical objects.
A member of one of several classes: natural numbers, integers, rational numbers, real numbers, complex numbers, quaternions.
A set of numerals for representing numbers.

bn:00028749n: A single serving of a beverage

bn:00057188n: An operation on logical values that changes true to false, and false to true.
In various logical and algebraic structures

In logic, negation, also called logical complement, is an operation that takes a proposition p to another proposition "not p", written Â¬ p, which is interpreted intuitively as being true when p is false and false when p is true.
A unary operation on logical values that changes true to false, and false to true.

A proposition which is the contradictory of another proposition and which can be obtained from that other proposition by the appropriately placed addition/insertion of the word "not". (Or, in symbolic logic, by prepending that proposition with the symbol for the logical operator "not".)
(logic) a proposition that is true if and only if another proposition is false

bn:00018345n: A pickpocket; a young or petty thief.
A piece or strip of potato that has been (usually deep-fat) fried and is commonly eaten with or as fast food.
A young person of either sex
A person not legally of age, or who is younger than may be charged with an offence
In law, a minor is a person under a certain age -- usually the age of majority -- which legally demarcates childhood from adulthood.
An account holder who is a family member, but not a parent, and who has limited use of the Internet. Children can view their own settings, but they can't change them.
A person who is too young to be considered legally competent according to the laws of a jurisdiction.
Age of majority, Legal age, Infancy
A person who is below the legal age of responsibility or accountability.
A person below the age of puberty.
A person who is below the age of adulthood; a minor .

bn:00000042n: The natural number following 17 and preceding 19
The cardinal number occurring after seventeen and before nineteen, represented in Roman numerals as XVIII and in Arabic numerals as 18.
18 is the natural number following 17 and preceding 19.
The cardinal number that is the sum of seventeen and one
